# constraints.Constraint { #optyx.constraints.Constraint }

```python
constraints.Constraint(expr, sense, name=None)
```

Represents an optimization constraint.

A constraint has the form: expr sense 0
where sense is one of: <=, >=, ==

The expression is normalized so RHS is always 0.
For example, x + y <= 5 becomes (x + y - 5) <= 0.

## Attributes {.doc-section .doc-section-attributes}

| Name   | Type                                              | Description                                                          |
|--------|---------------------------------------------------|----------------------------------------------------------------------|
| expr   | [Expression](`optyx.core.expressions.Expression`) | The constraint expression (LHS - RHS, so constraint is expr sense 0) |
| sense  | [str](`str`)                                      | The constraint type: "<=", ">=", or "=="                             |
| name   | [str](`str`) \| None                              | Optional name for the constraint                                     |

## Methods

| Name | Description |
| --- | --- |
| [evaluate](#optyx.constraints.Constraint.evaluate) | Evaluate the constraint expression at a point. |
| [get_variables](#optyx.constraints.Constraint.get_variables) | Get all variables in this constraint. |
| [is_satisfied](#optyx.constraints.Constraint.is_satisfied) | Check if constraint is satisfied at a point. |
| [violation](#optyx.constraints.Constraint.violation) | Compute constraint violation (0 if satisfied). |

### evaluate { #optyx.constraints.Constraint.evaluate }

```python
constraints.Constraint.evaluate(point)
```

Evaluate the constraint expression at a point.

Returns the value of expr at the point.
For a satisfied constraint:
    - <= constraint: value <= 0
    - >= constraint: value >= 0
    - == constraint: value == 0

### get_variables { #optyx.constraints.Constraint.get_variables }

```python
constraints.Constraint.get_variables()
```

Get all variables in this constraint.

### is_satisfied { #optyx.constraints.Constraint.is_satisfied }

```python
constraints.Constraint.is_satisfied(point, tol=1e-08)
```

Check if constraint is satisfied at a point.

| Name   | Type                                             | Description                       | Default    |
|--------|--------------------------------------------------|-----------------------------------|------------|

| tol    | [float](`float`)                                 | Tolerance for satisfaction check. | `1e-08`    |

#### Returns {.doc-section .doc-section-returns}
